paper_abstract: Artificial neural networks can be used as intelligent controllers to control non-linear, dynamic systems through learning, which can easily accommodate the non-linearities and time dependencies. However, they require large training time and large number of neurons to deal with complex problems. Taking benefit of the characteristics of a Generalized Neuron that requires much smaller training data and shorter training time, the pseudo-linear neural network (PNN) based model predictive approach used in the single and multi-machine power system studies is proposed in this paper. A simulation is carried out. It is demonstrated that the proposed control strategy is applicable to some of nonlinear systems.
paper_title: Adaptive control for synchronous generator based on pseudolinear neural networks
